name: One Hundred Years of Solitude
author: Gabriel García Márquez
description: A family saga in the magical town of Macondo, blending reality and fantasy.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian novel about a totalitarian regime that controls every aspect of life.

name: Don Quixote
author: Miguel de Cervantes
description: The adventures of a mad knight who confuses reality with fiction.

name: The Little Prince
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
description: A philosophical tale about a prince who travels the universe learning about life.

name: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A young girl narrates the fight against racism in the American South.

name: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A love story between Elizabeth Bennet and the proud Mr. Darcy.

name: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A mysterious millionaire seeks to reclaim a lost love during the Roaring Twenties.

name: Moby Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: Captain Ahab's obsessive quest for the white whale.

name: War and Peace
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: An epic portrait of Russian society during the Napoleonic Wars.

name: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A rebellious teenager recounts his experiences in New York.

name: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A futuristic society where control is exerted through pleasure and manipulation.

name: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A hobbit embarks on an epic adventure to reclaim treasure stolen by a dragon.

name: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: An Andalusian shepherd travels in search of his personal treasure and discovers life's true meaning.

name: The Picture of Dorian Gray
author: Oscar Wilde
description: A young man retains his youth while his portrait ages and reflects his moral corruption.

name: The Brothers Karamazov
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A family drama exploring themes of faith, morality, and freedom.

name: The Road
author: Cormac McCarthy
description: A father and son struggle to survive in a post-apocalyptic world.

name: The Odyssey
author: Homer
description: Odysseus' ten-year journey home after the Trojan War.

name: The Iliad
author: Homer
description: An epic poem about the rage of Achilles during the Trojan War.

name: Anna Karenina
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: An aristocratic woman falls in love with an officer, triggering a tragic fate.

name: Les Misérables
author: Victor Hugo
description: An ex-convict seeks redemption in 19th-century France.

name: Dracula
author: Bram Stoker
description: The story of the vampire count who terrorizes England.

name: The Count of Monte Cristo
author: Alexandre Dumas
description: A man unjustly imprisoned seeks revenge against those who betrayed him.

name: A Tale of Two Cities
author: Charles Dickens
description: A story of love and sacrifice during the French Revolution.

name: Great Expectations
author: Charles Dickens
description: A poor orphan dreams of becoming a gentleman thanks to a mysterious benefactor.

name: The Scarlet Letter
author: Nathaniel Hawthorne
description: A woman is condemned for adultery in Puritan New England.

name: The Jungle Book
author: Rudyard Kipling
description: The adventures of Mowgli, a boy raised by wolves in the Indian jungle.

name: The Metamorphosis
author: Franz Kafka
description: A man wakes up transformed into a giant insect.

name: The Old Man and the Sea
author: Ernest Hemingway
description: An old fisherman struggles to catch a giant fish at sea.

name: Fahrenheit 451
author: Ray Bradbury
description: In a future where books are banned, a fireman begins to question his role.

name: The Grapes of Wrath
author: John Steinbeck
description: A family of farmers migrates during the Great Depression in search of work.

name: Of Mice and Men
author: John Steinbeck
description: Two migrant workers dream of owning their own farm.

name: The Sun Also Rises
author: Ernest Hemingway
description: A group of expatriates travels through Spain, seeking meaning in their lives.

name: Catch-22
author: Joseph Heller
description: A satire about the absurdity of war and military bureaucracy.

name: Slaughterhouse-Five
author: Kurt Vonnegut
description: A soldier becomes 'unstuck in time' after surviving the bombing of Dresden.

name: Beloved
author: Toni Morrison
description: A former slave is haunted by the memories of her deceased daughter.

name: Invisible Man
author: Ralph Ellison
description: A Black man struggles to find his identity in a racist society.

name: The Bell Jar
author: Sylvia Plath
description: A young writer battles depression in the 1950s.

name: The Stranger
author: Albert Camus
description: An indifferent man is tried for a crime he committed without apparent motive.

name: The Trial
author: Franz Kafka
description: A man is arrested and prosecuted for a crime never revealed to him.

name: The Plague
author: Albert Camus
description: A city is struck by a plague, exploring themes of suffering and solidarity.

name: The Sound and the Fury
author: William Faulkner
description: The decline of a Southern family told from multiple perspectives.

name: As I Lay Dying
author: William Faulkner
description: A family travels to bury their mother, each with their own motivations.

name: East of Eden
author: John Steinbeck
description: A family saga exploring themes of good and evil in the Salinas Valley.

name: The Glass Menagerie
author: Tennessee Williams
description: A dysfunctional family dreams of escaping their reality.

name: A Streetcar Named Desire
author: Tennessee Williams
description: A fragile woman clashes with brutal reality while living with her sister and brother-in-law.

name: Death of a Salesman
author: Arthur Miller
description: An aging salesman grapples with failed dreams and his family relationships.

name: The Crucible
author: Arthur Miller
description: An allegory of McCarthyism through the Salem witch trials.

name: The Importance of Being Earnest
author: Oscar Wilde
description: A comedy of errors about false identities and love in Victorian high society.

name: Waiting for Godot
author: Samuel Beckett
description: Two men wait for someone named Godot in a play questioning the meaning of existence.

name: The Cherry Orchard
author: Anton Chekhov
description: An aristocratic family faces the loss of their home and way of life.

name: Uncle Vanya
author: Anton Chekhov
description: A man reflects on a life of sacrifices and missed opportunities.

name: The Seagull
author: Anton Chekhov
description: Artists and lovers explore love, art, and dissatisfaction at a country estate.

name: Three Sisters
author: Anton Chekhov
description: Three sisters dream of escaping their monotonous life in a small town.

name: The Master and Margarita
author: Mikhail Bulgakov
description: The devil visits Moscow in a satire blending the supernatural with social critique.

name: The Idiot
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A pure and kind-hearted man struggles to navigate a corrupt society.

name: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A student commits murder and suffers the psychological consequences of his crime.
